description: The pignut (Carya glabra) is amazing for its ability to grow in a wide variety of soil types and in sun or shade. Its edible nuts are encased in hard thick shells that are difficult to crack, with a sweet flavor that is likened to butternuts and hazelnuts. The pignut is also valued for its wood, which is of moderate strength, yet tough and durable. It is a valuable timber tree for furniture production. Birds also enjoy the pignut nuts for their high fat content, making it a great food source for wildlife. The pignut is truly an amazing species.
